verb.description: Put oneself deliberately into a place or situation where one is unwelcome or uninvited.
examples: he had no right to intrude into their lives
she felt awkward at intruding on private grief

verb.description: (of igneous rock) be forced or thrust into (a preexisting formation)
examples: the granite may have intruded these rock layers

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense usurp an office or right; originally as entrude): from Latin intrudere, from in- into + trudere to thrust.
